instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662 ALL power rails no post
threads.message:
Hi, got a 820-3662 with all power rails and no post. No liquid damage. looks to have had long screw damage to the lower two of the CPU screw standoffs, but the pads are still intact with no visible damage from the screw.
SPI rom reflashed with a clean ME bios, no difference in behaviour.
No chime, No display enable.ect (checked with multiple screens)

threads.title: 820-3662 ALL power rails no post
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 25403"]Long screw around CPU.....RIP.[/QUOTE]

thought so. i had a 2915 long screw around the PCH the other day.
Completely ruined.
